results.title: King Lear
results.creator_credit: Peter Brook, Michael Birkeit, Columbia, Martin Ransohoff Productions and Royal Shakespeare Company
results.brief_description: This Shakespearian tragedy tells the tale of woe when an old king decides to divide his kingdom amongst his daughters. Directed by Peter Brook and starring Paul Scofield and Irene Worth.

results.title: Hamlet (Richardson)
results.creator_credit: Tony Richardson and Columbia Pictures Industries
results.brief_description: Nicol Williamson plays Hamlet and Marianne Faithfull, Ophelia, in this version directed by Tony Richardson, filmed in London’s Round House Theatre. The strong close-ups emphasises the impact of the spoken word above all else in this production. The excellent cast includes Anthony Hopkins as Claudius, Judy Parfit as Gertrude and Gordon Jackson as Horatio.

results.title: 'Rivers of fire': an eruption of Hawaii's Mauna Loa Volcano
results.creator_credit: Les Malzman, Jon Erickson, Kathleen English, Hawaii Natural History Association and United States. National Park Service
results.brief_description: Examines the twenty two day eruption of Mauna Loa, the world’s largest volcano which started on 25 March 1984. Explains the Hawaiian volcanoes with spectacular photography within a well structured presentation which includes excellent graphics of plate tectonics and the hot spot theory.
results.title_for_label: ‘Rivers of fire’: an eruption of Hawaii’s Mauna Loa Volcano

results.title: Coping with exam anxiety
results.brief_description: A discussion about the ways in which anxiety and stress before exams, coupled with poor study techniques can adversely affect exams results. Demonstrates a number of techniques for the control of anxiety which will enable students to achieve peak examination performance.
results.description: A discussion about the ways in which anxiety and stress before exams, coupled with poor study techniques can adversely affect exams results. Demonstrates a number of techniques for the control of anxiety which will enable students to achieve peak examination performance.

results.title: Looking at Puffing Billy
results.brief_description: An enthusiasts video production about the Puffing Billy railway beginning with a brief history of the line, its relatively recent retoration, and the work of the Puffing Bily Preservation Society. We are taken on a detailed trip along the line from Belgrave to Emerald Lake.

results.title: Keeping ourselves safe
results.brief_description: Seven short dramatized vignettes on the subject of adults and older youths attempting to make sexual advances to children: “Fathers friend”, “The Photos”, “The Baby sitter”, “Jane and her uncle”, “The Swimming baths”, “Amanda and her father” and “On the bus”.

results.title: All about L.O.T.E.: languages other than English
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Can you speak a LOTE? Most students in Victorian schools are learning one. There are many ways of teaching it and many kinds of learners. This program shows students at schools around Melbourne learning and talking about Languages Other Than English.

results.title: Phiguring out acids and bases
results.creator_credit: Shane Mulcahy, Deborah Lawther, Glen Foster, Trish Pilley and Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Examines the acids and bases in everyday use and develops the idea of ph measurment both quantitatively and qualitatively as a measure of concentration.This program presents historical developments of the proton/theory and pH notation. Practical applications of pH testing and adjustments are also covered.

results.title: Some are more equal than others
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Briefly traces the history of the development of equal opportunity. A representative from the Equal Opportunity Board and the Youth Affairs Council discuss the equal opportunity legislation and how it affects youth.

results.title: New jig technology
results.creator_credit: Adrian Harvey, Bruce Shearer and Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: A program for employees and trainees in the automotive repair industry which looks at the development of two new automotive body repair technologies- dedicated jig systems and universal measuring systems. Both are fully explained and the advantages and disadvantages of each discussed.
